differential_diagnosis: infectious neuropathies (e.g., Lyme disease, HIV, hepatitis C)
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient's symptoms of rapid onset and progression, alongside nerve conduction studies showing markedly prolonged motor distal latencies and features inconsistent with his asymptomatic CMT1A, indicated an acute inflammatory demyelinating process. The workup ruled out various causes, and the findings of temporal dispersion and albuminocytologic dissociation in CSF suggest the presence of an underlying inflammatory neuropathy superimposed on the genetic condition.
